details: Was granted peerage on April 13 1802 (right at the end of his service), the first Baron Ellenborough.
Was granted peerage on January 31 1824 (after the end of his service), the first Baron Gifford.
Was granted peerage (first Baron Lyndhurst) in 1827 when he became the Lord Chancellor.
He was granted the title Baron Denman in 1834.
Was granted peerage in 1841, the first Baron Campbell.
Was granted peerage in 1841, the first Baron Campbell.
in 1850 upon his appointment as Lord Chancellor he was made Baron Truro.
Baron Chelmsford, of Chelmsford in the County of Essex in 1832.
in 1850 upon his appointment as Lord Chancellor he was made Baron Truro.
Ennobled Baron Romilly 1866. Master of Rolls from 1851 to 1873.
Baronet of Langton from 1858-1880. Chief justice from 1856-1880.
Baron Coleridge 1874-1894. Chief Justice for 7 years after AG.
Master of Rolls and Chief Justice. Baron Alverstone 1900-1915, Viscount 1913-1915.
Master of Rolls and Chief Justice. Baron Alverstone 1900-1915, Viscount 1913-1915.
Master of Rolls and Chief Justice. Baron Alverstone 1900-1915, Viscount 1913-1915.
Baron Reading 1914, Viscount 1916, Earl 1917, Marquess of Reading 1926-1935. Viceroy of India, Foreign Secretary, Leader of House of Lords.
